title: Projects
text:
Masterâ€™s Thesis: Evaluating the Impact of Passing Conditions and Retakes on Misclassification in the IBâ€™s Diploma Programme
Location: The Hague
Year: 2024-2025
Supervisor: Anton BÃ©guin
Languages: R, Fortran, Quarto
Conducted a masterâ€™s thesis focused on evaluating the impact of passing conditions and retakes on misclassification in the IBâ€™s Diploma Programme.



38th IRT Workshop
Location: Enschede
Year: 2024
Presented ongoing research on the topic of â€˜Navigating Optionality: Improving Reliability Estimates in Educational Measurementâ€™.


Investigating Respondentsâ€™ Opinions on Gender Questions in Large-scale Surveys
Location: Utrecht
Year: 2024 Supervisor: Katharina Meitinger, Angelo Moretti
Languages: Excel
Coded responses in English, Dutch, German, and French for a survey investigating preferences concerning gender measures in survey data.



Literature Review on Composite Indicators in Small Area Estimation
Location: Utrecht
Year: 2024
Supervisor: Angelo Moretti
Languages: /

Conducted a literature review of papers on composite indicators in small area estimation.
Searched online databases to build a formatted bibliography for the lead researcher.



Teaching Assistant for â€˜Multivariate Analysisâ€™ Summer School
Location: Utrecht
Year: 2024
Supervisor: Dave Hessen
Languages: SPSS
Prepared resources for discussion sessions and led tutorial sessions, explaining basic multivariate analysis techniques to social science students. Provided SPSS support during tutorials.


Building an Application for Determining Optimal Allocation Ratios in Clinical Trials
Location: Utrecht
Year: 2024
Supervisor: Mirjam Moerbeek
Languages: R, R Shiny
Developed an R Shiny application to find optimal allocation ratios in clinical trials using the Bayes Factor (BF). Conducted a simulation study to investigate the effect of different values of the BF and treatment effect on length of study in group sequential clinical trials. Prepared multilevel model exercises for a summer course taught by the supervisor.


Academic Replication
Location: Utrecht Year: 2024
Supervisor: Independent project
Languages: R
Github: Repository Link
Replicated the findings of Homes et al.Â (2021) and created an academic poster to present the results and methodology.


Improving the LISS Panel Imputation Procedure
Location: Utrecht
Year: 2023
Languages: R, R Shiny
R Shiny: R Shiny Link
Created an R Shiny app to demonstrate the limitations of the LISS panel imputation procedure and improved upon it using multiple and stepwise imputation methods in R.

title: Skills
text:
ðŸŸ¢ R


# Flipping a coin in R
coin_flip <- function() {
  outcome <- sample(c("Heads", "Tails"), size = 1)
  return(outcome)
}

coin_flip()





ðŸ”µ Python


# Flipping a coin in python
import random

def coin_flip():
    outcome = random.choice(["Heads", "Tails"])
    return outcome

coin_flip()





ðŸŸ  Fortran


! Flipping a coin with fortran subroutine
program coin_flip_program
  implicit none
  character(len=5) :: outcome

  call coin_flip(outcome)
  print *, 'The coin flip result is: ', outcome

contains

  subroutine coin_flip(result)
    character(len=5), intent(out) :: result
    real :: rand_num

    call random_seed()
    call random_number(rand_num)
    if (rand_num < 0.5) then
      result = 'Heads'
    else
      result = 'Tails'
    end if
  end subroutine coin_flip

end program coin_flip_program

end program coin_flip_program

title: About me
text: I am a psychometric researcher at Cito in Arnhem, the Netherlands, and was awarded the Masterâ€™s in Methodology and Statistics for the Behavioural, Biomedical and Social Sciences with Cum Laude by Utrecht University in 2025. My main areas of interest are educational measurement, survey design, and promoting reproducibility in research. Iâ€™m also into music; you can learn about everything I play on my sister website.
